description: The Government is instituting a curfew from 8 p.m. to 6 a.m. in the prefecture of Tchaoudjo where several cases of contamination by coronavirus have been detected in the town of Sokodé.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)

description: Nightly curfew in Togo was to end by January, 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: No the curfew times are always the same regardless of the day of the week
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Togo has extended Covid -19 state of health emergency from March 16, 2021 through to September, 2021

description: Suspension for two weeks from Friday, March 20, 2020 of all air routes from high-risk countries, namely: Italy, France, Spain and Germany;
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
All those suspected to have been infected with the coronavirus will be quarantined at the Lébénè Hotel (ex-Ibis/ Le Bénin). 

The government requisitioned the building for this purpose a little after announcing that all confirmed cases will be treated at CHR Lomé Commune.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As Togo readies to resume flights, the government informed that all travelers must submit a certificate proving they tested negative to Covid-19 before embarking on flights.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Government has launched https://voyage.gouv.tg a digital platform that allows travelers entering and leaving Togo, to carry out online, the immigration and health procedures necessary for travel safely.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Government is launching TOGO SAFE, a mobile “contact-tracing” application to strengthen the contact tracing of a person tested positive for COVID-19 and better contain the spread of the virus in Togo .
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Togo to supply its citizens with a three-month free supply of water and electricity as they move into Coronavirus curfew
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_text: Togo is providing free electricity and water for three months after it  declared a state of medical emergency

description:
January 27, 2021: The Italian Region of Lombardy issues ordinance N. 688/2021 stating that, when the area is identified as an Orange Zone, the measures described in article 4 of the Ordinance n. 649 December 9, 2020, are confirmed to be effective. These categories are allowed to move within the provincial territory: Provincial Police and the Police of  Milan related to wildlife control. Hunters for hunting activities in the hunting territorial area outside their municipality. Fishers either professional or amateur are allowed to move throughout the whole territory of the region.
The measures applies until March 5, 2021 UPDATE: misspelling
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: Other workers where the distinction between essential or non-essential is not explictely made (please note the occupation in the text entry)
